runs.comm: well stopped at point by 'that man' Dilshan, just opened the face of the bat and steered it
fuller in length and softly pushed towards mid-on by Charles
Mathews keeps it full and straight, moves away slightly and Charles softly pushes it down the track
Charles is off the mark with a gentle clip towards square leg
stays back and punches it wide of cover and sets off quickly, Gayle's off the mark too
first forceful shot but not a convincing one, heaved it towards midwicket and it was in the air but mistimed, Herath does the chasing
lands outside off and softly pushed to the off side
comes back in slightly and he punches it down to mid-on
another heave across the line but the ball gets the inside edge and rolls to the leg side
nice tight line to Gayle, on the middle stump from over the wicket and quietly defended
turns the bat slightly and he clips it towards midwicket
end of a very good over, fuller and Gayle turned the bat to work it wide of mid-on, straight to Malinga and no point risking a run
the introduction of Malinga brings up a boundary straightaway, too straight on the pads and flicked away to the leg side, fine leg was up, just used the pace
slower ball and he reached out a stabbed at it, checked his shot and it was in the air for a while before rolling to mid-off
teasing him with another slower, shorter and wider, Charles hung his bat out and nearly edged it
quite effortless, it was quicker and pitched up, fetched that from middle and lofted it over the bowler's head, timed it well
slower ball and he brings it back in and he clips it straight to midwicket
gives him width and he slaps it straight to point, better over for West Indies
tests out Gayle with a yorker length ball, he did well to jam it out in front of the off stump
slower ball and an ungainly swipe across the line wide of square leg, mistimed that one
Kula's testing them both with the slower ball, Charles made a lot of room to bash that over his head and he missed it completely
boundary ball and he failed to cash in, full toss on the pads and he only managed to play it onto his pads
risky run! Charles made room and slapped it towards extra cover, had Mathews been quicker on the throw Gayle would have been in big trouble, just missed the stumps
fuller on the off stump and forcefully played straight to mid-off, slow start by Windies
spun away and really foxed him! Close to the edge and the stumps
Charles moves across and gets on his knee to sweep, clips the pad and there's an appeal but the umpire reckoned it wasn't hitting
negotiates that by padding it to the leg side
Charles goes back and across and slashes and misses, sharp turn

reward for some excellent bowling by Mendis, Charles doesn't see any point in using the crease against Mendis so he decides to give him the charge, fails to read the googly and he's a long way out, easy stumping
turns and beats the outside edge! Another wicket maiden for Mendis - his 3rd of the tournament

Kula's got the Big Fish! Look at the bowler celebrate, slower ball - leg cutter - and really wide of the off stump, Gayle couldn't resist chasing that after being subdued for so long, thick outside edge and it loops towards Sangakkara who dives and takes the catch
what a good way to get off the mark, fuller delivery coming back in and Bravo just showed the full face of the bat and punched it wide of mid-on
gets across and punches it towards the covers
gets across and pushes it firmly towards cover again
this time he's beaten outside the off stump, poked his bat out and kept a bit low as well
gets across his stumps and pushes a full delivery down to midwicket
nips back in and he tucks it away down to square leg
close call! Punches towards mid-off and he has to hurry, the throw was just wide of the stumps at the bowler's end
deliberately done, tucked him up for room and Samuels took advantage of the fact that there was no slip, opened the face of the bat and cheekily dabbed it past the keeper
punches it with soft hands towards mid-on
power behind this shot, wide outside the off stump and he gets his bat down and forces it wide of mid-off and cover, quite a big follow through
another edge past the keeper, no slip, slower ball and I don't think he intended to dab it past the keeper, Kulasekara picks up from third man
tossed up and driven down the pitch and Herath and Bravo collided and the ball slipped past the bowler, they take the run anyway, was that fair?
tossed up and defended back to the bowler
brute force on that one, tossed up and full outside the off stump and crashed past the covers
the carrom ball, managed to defend that one
gets across and defends down the track
tossed up outside off and he pushes it down to cover
another edgy shot, this one sneaks past first slip, skidded off the pitch
shuffles and tucks it down to square leg
stayed back to punch it through the off side, the carrom ball skids and beats the bat, half-hearted appeal
gets across his stumps and clips it away close to his pads to the leg side, risks exposing his stumps
stays back and punches it down to mid-on, no turn there
drives it straight to extra cover
lovely shot! Used the crease to a spinner and still managed to loft it high and far over long-off, got a lot of bat behind that
chips down the track and drives to long-on
missed stumping but a tough one! Down the track and floated down the leg side, went between the batsman's legs and Sanga fumbled
gives him the charge and lofts it towards long-on
comes forward and drives to sweeper cover
down the track and chipped down the ground, two fielders converge
stays back and punches it high over cover
down the track and it bounces once to Herath at long-on, he fumbles and the ball nearly carries over him to the boundary
driven towards cover
defends the googly, Mendis keeping things tight
tosses it up more and he plays it straight to cover
he can't squeeze that past point, stifling opening over
another one skids through and beats the bat and the keeper fumbles, funny old day for Sanga
hits the pad first and a confident appeal, that was missing the off stump
comes down the track and pads it away without offering a shot, they take a leg bye
bashed! Shades of Shane Watson caning India there, dropped short, rocked back and bludgeoned over deep midwicket
comes forward and he pushes it to the off side
knocks it down to long-on for a single
fires that full and wide outside off, opens the face and steers it wide of point
cleverly done! Why can't they place a slip? Tucks him up for room and he opens the face and gently dabs it past Sangakkara, we've seen a few of those today
slower ball and he pushes it wide of cover point
aims for the yorker on the leg stump and he jams it down to midwicket
the bouncer! I suspect we will see more of this when WI come out to bowl, Samuels just ducks under that
no slip and another cheeky dab down to third man, Kula is more fine so he easily picks it up
fuller delivery outside the off stump and he goes for the drive and misses it completely
full and crashed down to long-off, powerful shot
another slower ball and a swing and a miss, they steal a bye
low full toss and jammed out down the ground, bounces over the bowler
wow! Crisp timing there, full outside the off stump and he calmly opened the face of the bat and steered it past point, the fielders didn't move, used the pace on the ball
full on the pads and turned towards midwicket
teases him with flight, comes down the track and he mistimes it, gets an inside edge
driven wide of the bowler and great stuff from Mendis to dive to his left and stop that
big blow for West Indies with the solid Bravo gone! It was short and turned a bit too, Bravo rocked back and pulled it over mid-on, long-on takes it easily in front of the rope
clips a low full toss down to deep midwicket
heads up! Tossed up and he chips down the track and lofts it, miles up in the air and the crowd at wide long-on had to take cover
down the track again and not quite the same result, rolls towards long-on
tossed up and he pushes it to the off side
it was short and he can only punch it straight to cover
now he teases him by landing it full, yorks him
cannot take a run off this one, Mendis testing Pollard
that's Mendis' 100th wicket in T20s (including domestic)! And he gets the big man, pushed through quicker and Pollard was forward, beaten in flight and yorked himself
starts off by fetching it from outside off and sweeping him, in the air for a while
good running, squeezed out to the off side and they set off quickly for the run
awkwardly chipped away over midwicket, it was a fast yorker
another testing yorker on the leg stump, he makes room and squeezes it out, how do you put away those? Ask Kohli
jams out another yorker wide of the bowler for a single to long-on
makes room and bashes a full delivery down to long-off
fires it full on the pads and he whips it down to deep midwicket, good fielding at the boundary
goes high and long, chips down the track and he whams a straight six over the bowler's head
low full toss and he drills it down to long-on
almost all the way to the second tier! Pitched up and he makes room, gets under the bounce and muscles it high over the bowler's head, one of the longer sixes we've seen, 102m, the biggest so far
yorker outside off and he makes room and fails to make contact
Kula getting caned here, full and wide and Samuels makes room and crashes that wide of extra cover
make that 21 off the over! Samuels makes room to a fuller delivery and bashes that down the ground along the turf, nobody was around to stop that
the slower ball and cleverly pitched shorter, the batsman made room to slash that but missed it
makes room and carves it over cover, long-off comes across to his left and catches it on the bounce
Samuels slashes at thin air, the slower bouncer and he was too early on the pull
this time he decides to stay at the crease and easily dabs it down to third man to bring up his fifty
shorter delivery and Russell swings and the ball takes the bottom edge and bounces towards Sanga, he's had a tough time behind the stumps
fetches a short one from outside off and pulls towards long-on, Perera catches it awkwardly on the bounce
pulls the first ball hard and along the turf to Dilshan at long-on
excellent catch by Dilshan! He pulls a short one on front of square and it was in the air for quite a while, Dilshan ran to his right from long-on and kept his eyes on the ball, two fielders converge
short ball and pulled away high but it drops short of deep square leg
fuller ball and forcefully pushed down to long-on
low full toss and he swings it to the on side
ends the innings with a yorker which Sammy squirts to the on side and it's only a single
